intro: Lloydia cretica, commonly known as the crested lloydia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, branched stems and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
